page.title: 04POPULATION OF MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: According to the 1981 census,the permanent population was 300,but it has now risen to about 425.This increase is largely due to the building of about 140 new homes which attracted the following:- 1) Retired people,most from the Midlands,many of whom had previously spent hollidays in the area. 2) People buying holiday homes,some intending to live here permanently after retiring,but some as an investment,letting the houses to holidaymakers. 3) People working in the area,the largest number in the tourist industry and the second largest for the CEGB at Trawsfnydd power station.
